name: biobb_ml AgglomerativeCoefficient
title: Wrapper of the scikit-learn AgglomerativeCoefficient method.
description: Clusters a given dataset and calculates best K coefficient. Visit the AgglomerativeClustering documentation page in the sklearn official website for further information.

output_results_path.description: Path to the gap values list

file_formats.description: Path to the gap values list

output_plot_path.description: Path to the elbow method and gap statistics plot

file_formats.description: Path to the elbow method and gap statistics plot

predictors.description: Features or columns from your dataset you want to use for fitting. You can specify either a list of columns names from your input dataset, a list of columns indexes or a range of columns indexes. Formats: { "columns": ["column1", "column2"] } or { "indexes": [0, 2, 3, 10, 11, 17] } or { "range": [[0, 20], [50, 102]] }. In case of mulitple formats, the first one will be picked.

max_clusters.description: Maximum number of clusters to use by default for kmeans queries.

affinity.description: Metric used to compute the linkage. If linkage is "ward", only "euclidean" is accepted.

property_formats.name: euclidean
property_formats.description: Computes the Euclidean distance between two 1-D arrays

property_formats.name: cosine
property_formats.description: Compute the Cosine distance between 1-D arrays

property_formats.name: precomputed
property_formats.description: means that the flatten array containing the upper triangular of the distance matrix of the original data is used

linkage.description: The linkage criterion determines which distance to use between sets of observation. The algorithm will merge the pairs of cluster that minimize this criterion.

property_formats.name: ward
property_formats.description: minimizes the variance of the clusters being merged

property_formats.name: complete
property_formats.description: uses the maximum distances between all observations of the two sets

property_formats.name: average
property_formats.description: uses the average of the distances of each observation of the two sets

property_formats.name: single
property_formats.description: uses the minimum of the distances between all observations of the two sets

scale.description: Whether or not to scale the input dataset.

restart.description: Do not execute if output files exist.
